clauses.title: Lease Term
clauses.summary: This clause defines the start and end dates of the lease agreement. Knowing the term is crucial for planning and understanding your commitment to the property.
obligations: Tenant must occupy the premises for the full term.
Tenant must vacate by the end of the term.
risks: Automatic renewal if not properly noticed before the end of the term.
clauses.original_text: The Agreement shall begin on _________________ and end on _________________ (“Term”).

clauses.title: Rent Payment
clauses.summary: This clause establishes the monthly rent amount and due date. Consistent, on-time rent payments are essential to avoid late fees and potential eviction.
obligations: Tenant must pay rent in the amount specified.
Tenant must pay rent on the date specified.
risks: Late fees if rent is not paid on time.
clauses.original_text: The Tenant shall pay the Landlord in equal monthly installments of $___________ (“Rent”). The Rent shall be due on the ____ of every month and paid under the following instructions: ____________________________________________________________________________.

clauses.title: Security Deposit
clauses.summary: This clause details the amount of the security deposit and the conditions for its return. The deposit protects the landlord against damage beyond normal wear and tear.
obligations: Tenant must pay the security deposit (if required).
risks: Potential loss of deposit due to damage.
clauses.original_text: The Tenant (check one): ☐ Shall deposit with the Landlord the sum of $___________ as security for any damage caused to the Premises during the Term. Such deposit shall be returned to the Tenant, less any itemized deductions, within ______ days after the end of the Term.
